title: 2  Level 1 – The Temple of Smriti (Memory)
text:
2.1 Part I – First Steps: Repeated Integration
Characters:
- Acharya Anvaya (Guide/Teacher, continuity of knowledge)
- Ananya (Learner, seeker of truth)
Scene: Ananya and Acharya Anvaya stand before the Temple of Smriti (Memory). Its walls glow faintly with carved verses. Above the arch is inscribed:
“कालः स्मृतिर्नित्यं — Kālaḥ Smṛtir Nityaṁ (Time is eternal memory).”
Acharya Anvaya: Ananya, before the temple reveals its secret, let us recall what happens when we integrate repeatedly.
Question: What is the integral of \(1\)?
Ananya:
\[
I^1 (1)(t) = \int_0^t 1\, d\tau = t.
\]
Acharya Anvaya: Good. And integrating once more?
Ananya:
\[
I^2 (1)(t) = \int_0^t I^1(1)(\tau)\, d\tau = \int_0^t \tau\, d\tau = \frac{t^2}{2!}.
\]

title: 2  Level 1 – The Temple of Smriti (Memory)
text:
2.2 Part II – The Cauchy Formula
Acharya Anvaya: This can be written using the Cauchy formula for repeated integration:
\[
I^n f(t) = \frac{1}{(n-1)!} \int_0^t (t-\tau)^{\,n-1} f(\tau)\, d\tau.
\]

section: 2.3 Part III – The Bridge of Gamma
text:
2.3 Part III – The Bridge of Gamma
Acharya Anvaya: Replace factorials by the Gamma function to continue to fractional orders:
\[
(I^\alpha f)(t) = \frac{1}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\int_0^t (t-\tau)^{\alpha-1} f(\tau)\, d\tau.
\]

2.3.1 Mini-Quest: The Half-Memory
Evaluate \((I^{1/2} 1)(t)\). The answer is
\[
(I^{1/2} 1)(t) = \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}} t^{1/2}.
\]
You have earned the Key of Smriti (Memory).
